Description: Sherd of bowl (mended from two fragments) of Laconian black-figured pottery kylix; dull cream slip; interior: black-figure decoration consisting of soldier kneeling or collapsing to left (greaved knee and part of shield with decorative elements in added red remaining); glaze at left break; exergue line below; exterior: glazed around top of stem; to the outside, two bands and pomegranate frieze.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888,0601.526.k and 1888,0601.526.j. This sherd has also been attributed to the Hephaistos Painter, who has been renamed the Boreads Painter (Lane 1933-1934, 131, no 12). The kylix has also been attributed to the Arkesilas Painter (Shefton 1954, 300, no. 9).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B7.4.12)
